answer: <p>You only show one row so your use case may be limited to just that.  Just in case you have multiple rows, this plugin - <a href="https://github.com/Sam152/Javascript-Grids">github Javascript-grids</a> - works perfectly!  It makes each panel expand to the tallest panel, giving each row potentially a different height based on the tallest panel in that row. It's a jquery solution vs. css, but wanted to recommend it as an alternative approach.</p>
<p>I know I'm very late but now you can use the "min-height" style attribute to achieve your purpose.</p>
